intro: Scaligeria conica, commonly known as the narrow-leaved scalerie, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, upright stems and finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, arranged in umbels. It is native to regions of southern Europe and is often found in dry, rocky habitats. Scaligeria conica is valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
